semantic_title: Coding Previous Conditions as Additional Diagnoses

content.full_text: If the provider has included a diagnosis in the final diagnostic statement, such as the discharge summary or the face sheet, it should ordinarily be coded. Some providers include in the diagnostic statement resolved conditions or diagnoses and status-post procedures from previous admissions that have no bearing on the current stay. Such conditions are not to be reported and are coded only if required by hospital policy. However, history codes (categories Z80-Z87) may be used as secondary codes if the historical condition or family history has an impact on current care or influences treatment. (Evidence: pg no: 111, L76-L78)
content.summary: Previous conditions should only be coded if they impact current care, with specific rules for resolved conditions and history codes (Evidence: pg no: 111, L76-L78)
